title: Document marketing module fix and verification
close_reason: Closed

comments.author: mytech-today-now
comments.text: DOCUMENTATION COMPLETE: Marketing module fix and verification documented. Findings: (1) Module exists at augment-extensions/domain-rules/seo-sales-marketing with complete structure. (2) Module.json shows 288,256 characters across 12 rules, 8 examples, 5 schemas. (3) MODULES.md catalog entry exists at lines 361-385 with full description. (4) Module includes comprehensive documentation: README.md, ANNOUNCEMENT.md, USAGE-GUIDES.md, TEST-VALIDATION.md, SCHEMA-VALIDATION-REPORT.md. (5) All rule files present: universal-marketing.md, brand-consistency.md, asset-management.md, legal-compliance.md, conversion-optimization.md, seo-optimization.md, content-marketing.md, social-media-marketing.md, email-marketing.md, ppc-advertising.md, affiliate-influencer-marketing.md, direct-sales.md. (6) All example files present: seo-blog-post, social-media-campaign, email-newsletter, landing-page, ppc-ad-copy, brand-kit, campaign-brief, content-calendar. (7) All schemas present: brand-kit, color-palette, campaign-brief, content-template, asset-inventory. CONCLUSION: No fix needed - module is fully functional and properly documented.

title: Investigate Marketing module visibility issue
close_reason: Closed

comments.author: mytech-today-now
comments.text: INVESTIGATION COMPLETE: Marketing module (seo-sales-marketing) is fully functional and visible. Module location: augment-extensions/domain-rules/seo-sales-marketing/. Module contains: 12 rule files, 8 example files, 5 JSON schemas, module.json with 288,256 character count. Module is documented in MODULES.md at line 361-385. Module structure verified: all files present including README.md, ANNOUNCEMENT.md, USAGE-GUIDES.md, TEST-VALIDATION.md, and SCHEMA-VALIDATION-REPORT.md. No visibility issues found - module is properly structured and cataloged.

title: Design extraction algorithm for detecting and extracting subcommands
description: Design algorithm for subcommand detection logic, recursive extraction approach, and identify edge cases
close_reason: Created openspec/changes/dynamic-command-help/design/extraction-algorithm.md with pattern matching strategies, recursive extraction approach, edge cases, and performance optimizations

title: Design Markdown output format for AI-friendly help reference
description: Design Markdown template, hierarchy (tool → command → subcommand), and code block formatting
close_reason: Created openspec/changes/dynamic-command-help/design/markdown-output-format.md with template structure, hierarchy definition, formatting rules, and complete example

title: Phase 1: Specification - Create formal specifications and design for dynamic command help
close_reason: Phase 1 completed: All child tasks (bd-m4ca, bd-2nyf, bd-atvn) completed. Spec exists, extraction algorithm designed, Markdown output format designed

title: Create extractCommandHelp utility module
description: Create cli/src/utils/extractCommandHelp.ts with tool detection, help extraction function, and error handling
close_reason: Created cli/src/utils/extractCommandHelp.ts with tool detection (detectTools), help extraction (executeHelp, extractHelpRecursive), subcommand detection (detectSubcommands), Markdown generation (generateMarkdown), and comprehensive error handling

title: Implement subcommand detection logic
description: Add subcommand parsing function, pattern matching for common help formats, support for multiple help styles
close_reason: Implemented subcommand detection in cli/src/utils/extractCommandHelp.ts with multiple pattern matching strategies (Commands section, Available commands, Usage patterns), extractCommandNames function, and integration with recursive extraction

title: Phase 2: Core Implementation - Implement extraction engine and utilities
close_reason: Phase 2 completed: Created extractCommandHelp utility (bd-1tf9) with subcommand detection (bd-e76i), recursive extraction, and Markdown generation. All core implementation tasks completed

title: Screenplay Writing Standards Extension
description: Implement comprehensive screenplay writing and crafting standards module for Augment Extensions with universal formatting standards, narrative structures, character development, and category-specific rules for AAA Hollywood films, independent films, TV series, web content, news broadcasts, commercials, streaming content, and live TV productions
close_reason: Module already fully implemented with all rules, examples, schemas, genres, styles, and themes. Located at augment-extensions/writing-standards/screenplay/ with 163,500 characters. Includes 24 rule files, 8 example files, 6 JSON schemas, and comprehensive subdirectories for genres, styles, and themes

title: Phase 2: Core Implementation - Implement extraction engine and utilities
close_reason: Duplicate of bd-wgxi which is already completed. Both tasks have identical title and description. bd-wgxi was completed with extractCommandHelp utility implementation

title: Implement recursive help extraction
description: Add recursive extraction logic, depth limiting to prevent infinite loops, parallel execution for performance
close_reason: Already implemented in cli/src/utils/extractCommandHelp.ts. Function extractHelpRecursive (lines 129-167) includes recursive extraction logic, depth limiting (maxDepth parameter, line 137), and parallel execution using Promise.all (line 152)

title: Implement Markdown generation function
description: Create Markdown generation function with template-based output and proper escaping/formatting
close_reason: Already implemented in cli/src/utils/extractCommandHelp.ts. Function generateMarkdown (lines 198-221) creates template-based Markdown output with proper formatting. Helper function formatHelpNode (lines 226-243) handles hierarchical formatting with code blocks

title: Phase 3: Integration - Integrate extraction with augx init command
close_reason: Integrated command help extraction with augx init command. Modified cli/src/commands/init.ts to import extractCommandHelp utility and call it after character count rule installation. Extraction generates .augment/COMMAND_HELP.md with help for all detected workflow tools (Beads, OpenSpec, Augx). Includes error handling with fallback message

title: Design GUI architecture and component structure
description: Design the terminal GUI architecture using inquirer library. Create architecture document, component breakdown, and user flow diagrams
close_reason: GUI architecture already fully designed and documented. Architecture document exists at cli/docs/GUI_ARCHITECTURE.md with component hierarchy, CSS structure, TypeScript interfaces, and wireframes. Implementation exists in cli/src/commands/gui.ts using inquirer library. Configuration types defined in cli/src/types/gui.ts. GUI configuration guide at cli/docs/GUI_CONFIGURATION.md

title: Modify augx init command to call extraction
description: Update cli/src/commands/init.ts to call extraction, add extraction step, add progress logging
close_reason: Duplicate of bd-gh5c. The integration with augx init command was already completed as part of bd-gh5c. File cli/src/commands/init.ts already imports extractCommandHelp (line 6) and calls it after character count rule installation (line 120) with progress logging and error handling

title: Implement error recovery and handling
description: Add graceful handling of missing tools, timeout handling, clear error messages, non-blocking failures
close_reason: Already implemented in cli/src/utils/extractCommandHelp.ts. Graceful handling of missing tools: ENOENT check (line 182-183). Timeout handling: timeout parameter (line 73), ETIMEDOUT check (line 184-185). Clear error messages: console.warn/error with descriptive messages (lines 164, 183, 185, 187). Non-blocking failures: try-catch in loop continues to next tool on failure (lines 177-189)

description: Tests for tool detection, help extraction, subcommand parsing, and Markdown generation
title: Create unit tests for extraction utilities
close_reason: Created comprehensive unit tests for extractCommandHelp utility in cli/src/utils/__tests__/extractCommandHelp.test.ts. Tests cover: tool detection (3 tests), subcommand detection (5 tests), Markdown generation (5 tests), and edge cases (3 tests). Total: 16 unit tests covering all core functions.

description: Test with all tools present, missing tools, command failures, and verify output file correctness
title: Create integration tests for full extraction flow
close_reason: Created comprehensive integration tests for extractCommandHelp in cli/src/utils/__tests__/extractCommandHelp.integration.test.ts. Tests cover: full extraction flow with all tools (3 tests), extractAllHelp function (2 tests), detectTools function (3 tests), and output file creation (1 test). Total: 9 integration tests with 30-second timeouts for real command execution.

title: Create microservices migration example

close_reason: Created monolith-to-microservices-migration.md with comprehensive migration example using Strangler Fig Pattern. Includes initial monolith state (500K LOC, pain points), target microservices architecture with service decomposition, migration strategy phases (assessment, infrastructure setup, service extraction), detailed implementation of Product Service extraction with facade pattern, dual-write data migration, gradual traffic rollout with feature flags, database cutover strategy, service extraction order for remaining services, challenges and solutions (data consistency with Saga pattern, event-driven communication, contract testing), before/after metrics showing 40% faster response time and 60% database load reduction. 651 lines total.

close_reason: Created trading-eventdriven.md with comprehensive stock trading system example using event-driven architecture.
